org.threadly.litesockets

Interface Server.ServerCloseListener

  • Enclosing class:
    Server

    public static interface Server.ServerCloseListener
    Used to notify when a Server connection is closed.

    This is called once a Close is detected on the Servers Socket. Since it can happen on any thread as well you might get new clients for this server shortly after it closes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onClose(Server server)
      Invoked once the provided server has been detected to be in a closed state.
      default void onCloseWithError(Server server, java.lang.Throwable error)
      Invoked once the provided server has been closed due to an error.

    • Method Detail

      • onClose

        void onClose(Server server)
        Invoked once the provided server has been detected to be in a closed state.
        Parameters:
        server - The Server that has been closed.

      • onCloseWithError

        default void onCloseWithError(Server server,
                              java.lang.Throwable error)
        Invoked once the provided server has been closed due to an error.

        By default this will invoked ExceptionUtils.handleException(Throwable) and then invoke Object.clone(). If you override this you must also invoke Server.close() if you want that logic shared / reused during an error condition.

        Parameters:
        server - The Server that has been closed.
        error - The exception which resulted in the client closing
